this here  it s not that cpw doesn t want wolves on the landscape  hardcore anti wolf sentiment is an extremely biased take  and not reflective of general sentiment amongst coloradans or state biologists  but cpw has a lot of other priorities they have to balance with private land managers  they can t force the hands of private land owners  instead they have to build rapport the old school way  if wolves moved in naturally cpw could have managed their populations relatively dramatically free  but this forced reintroduction of wolves simultaneously takes away cpw s power to manage the task effectively while putting them against private land managers   ""

it isn't that simple  we are are not allowed to just turn cattle out on the permit and leave them alone  there are strict guidelines and rules we have to follow or we risk losing the permit and them selling it to someone else  the biggest 2 things are having a range rider on the mountain every day  typically living in cow camps but not always  and following the grazing rotation  we receive maps that tell us how many days the cows can stay in a certain area and what dates they are in and out  the range rider has to keep the herd in those designated areas  these areas are fairly large and cattle move in herds so it's not unusual to move a few big herds and have some stragglers catch up a day or 2 later  and we don't tend to get an incredibly accurate count until it's time to bring the cows off the permit and home  so taking 1or 2 cows every day on a 1000 cow permit wouldn't necessarily be a noticeable amount until they are in the corrals and being counted  then everyone spends weeks looking for the missing cows on the entire permit  if no sign is found we then consider them dead  most likely killed by predator that drug them off and ate them or just old age  but again we are talking 10 15 not 100 to 200  ""

the mission of the u s  forest service is to maintain the health  diversity  and productivity of the nation s forests and grasslands for the benefit of current and future generations  the forest service s motto is  caring for the land and serving people    ""
the forest service manages the country s national forests and grasslands  which cover over 192 million acres  the agency s responsibilities include   ""
recreation  providing opportunities for people to enjoy the forest  ""
timber  managing forests for timber production  ""
wilderness  protecting wilderness areas  ""
minerals  managing forests for minerals  ""
water  managing forests for water  ""
grazing  managing forests for grazing  ""
fish and wildlife  managing forests for fish and wildlife  ""

oh absolutely  brands only work if you're selling legally or taking them to a slaughter house  brands have to be checked prior to slaughter typically   but i am learning that a lot of people buying livestock don't understand that they come with a title just like cars  prior to transfer of ownership the state brand inspector comes out and inspects them  if you buy a branded cow then put your brand on it you need to keep all the paperwork from the original sale for proof  just like a car title and vin number ""

obviously they can be born year round  but standard practice in co is to calve in the spring  brand shortly after  then turn them out on range land for the summer to take advantage of the good grass  it's completely illogical to turn out 180 cows on range land  mostly calves  without brands  ""

maybe i'm wrong  but this is what i was taught during my undergraduate and graduate programs which focused on resource management  and from my experience working for a federal land management agency  ""
recreation is secondary to extraction for usfs  which can be seen by comparing the mission statements of usfs  blm  and nps  ""
blm   the bureau of land management's mission is to sustain the health  diversity  and productivity of public lands for the use and enjoyment of present and future generations   ""

nps   the national park service preserves unimpaired the natural and cultural resources and values of the national park system for the enjoyment  education  and inspiration of this and future generations   ""
usfs is the only one of these three agencies whose official mission statement does not include  enjoyment   which is the term that describes recreational use   ""

sustain maintain  health  diversity  and productivity  versus  preserves unimpaired  refers to how they achieve their goal  nps tries to maintain lands in their 'natural' state as much as possible  usfs   blm tries to maintain lands in a way that allows for continued resource extraction  ""

cattle damage can be problematic  especially when land management agencies don't adjust grazing permits  cattle are  meant  to be managed in ways to reduce damage to public lands  and our techniques have improved a lot over the last 100 years   ""

the main benefit is that it lowers the cost of good  anything product that comes from public lands would be much more expensive if it only came from private land  that includes everything from beef to lumber to various minerals  ""

yep  that's why i keep saying that it is secondary  not that it doesn't matter at all  don't take my word for it though  go look at the laws that establish the national forest system and define it's purpose  ""

16 usc 475 establishes the purposes of national forests  which is to  improve and protect the forest        secure favorable conditions of water flows  and to furnish a continuous supply of timber for the use and necessities of citizens of the united states   ""
this is pretty clear  the primary purpose defined by law is 1  protection of forests   waters and 2  timber extraction  this comes from the organic administation act of 1897  ""

16 usc 528 comes from the multiple use sustained yield act of 1960  which adds that national forests  shall be administered for outdoor recreation  range  timber  watershed  and wildlife and fish purposes        supplemental to  but not in derogation of   16 usc 475    ""

this means the listed purposes  including recreation  are additional uses   supplemental to   for national forests  but that these additional uses cannot take away from   not in derogation of   the primary mission established in 16 usc 475  ""

all relevant laws since the 1960 act continue to use the  multiple use  terminology and reference 16 usc 528  but they never change 16 usc 475  this makes it clear that the usfs' primary objective has remained the same since its creation  protection of forests and timber extraction  ""
